snippet: At a technology conference, the company’s chief executive addressed recent reports that questioned the reliability of its tests.

byline.contributor: Katie Benner reported from Laguna Beach, and Andrew Pollack from Los Angeles. Mike Isaac contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By KATIE BENNER and ANDREW POLLACK

abstract: Elizabeth Holmes, founder of $9 billion blood testing laboratory firm Theranos, is embroiled in public fracas to defend her reputation and her closely watched Silicon Valley firm; Wall Street Journal questions accuracy of company's blood tests and whether technology is truly unique.
lead_paragraph: At a technology conference, the company’s chief executive addressed recent reports that questioned the reliability of its tests.

headline.print_headline: Blood Lab That Boasts Breakthrough Goes on Defense Against Its Doubters
headline.main: Theranos, a Blood Testing Start-Up, Defends Its Accuracy
